intro: Clidemia rhodopogon, commonly known as the red-flowered false heather, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Clidemia rhodopogon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
